ProductReadinessOnOCP: Current published roadmap indicates parity ETA : 2H23
ModernizationGuidanceNotes:
• Parity exists in some scenarios; there were capabilities missing in v4.5 (see details tab)
  • Some gaps documented in Big 5 (Product Scout Program) and issue tracker list for data and AI.
  • Client discussion should focus on features they want to maintain in IGC + understanding the roadmap of WKC through 4.6 and 4.7, removal of legacy artifacts and replacement with new capabilities
  • Understand the implications of Data Product Marketplace capabilities (separate product)
  • Understand Miti and Manta strategy
AdditionalNotes:
Features not available in version prior to 4.7 are documented on the product scout page on both the big 5 and issue tracker for data and ai at this location: https://w3.ibm.com/w3publisher/product-scout-program

  1. Meta data management part 1 (workflow capability, custom ui attributes, asset versioning, custom attributes based on role).
  2. Meta Data management part 2 (extension mapping; open IGC for lineage, data quality rules and monitoring of modern governance, for data quality rules).
  3. Metadata audibility (import/export).
  4. Usability- eliominate co-existance of 2 catalogs, Business user view.
  5. Some data sources (please refer to Manta roadmap).
SupportingAssets:
• Slack Channel for WKC: #askanythingwkc
  • WKC and Data Lineage Roadmap: https://ibm.seismic.com/Link/Folder/DCe666af8
  • WKC Reference Data Roadmap and Feature Matrix: https://ibm.seismic.com/Link/Content/DCMdgFjVhHbdg8hWXhpFJ3H9D94d
  • Customer use case winning against competition: https://ibm.box.com/s/9e58lif14q30m40yfbub5dky97a6zda1
  • Manta Data Lineage: https://ibm.seismic.com/Link/Content/DC9CB62G4qM4pG7B34Rgd3qVRg83

  • Data & AI Big 5 List (Product Scout Feature Gap List): https://w3.ibm.com/w3publisher/product-scout-program/the-big-5

ModernizationGuidanceNotes:
• Modernization discussion: Focus on “Modern MDM” perspective, current approach to changing capabilities is three pronged:
    1. Match 360
    2. MDM Cartridge (For new MDM Customers)
    3. MDM AE/SE for existing customers
  • AE/SE version is containerized but not on CP4D. CE version available as MDM Product Master on CP4D
  • Existing MDM AE/SE customers should wait for feature parity readiness before migrating, or look to extend capability with Match360 in the interim. Net new customers can consider using MDM on containers

• Missing some functionality used by some of our large customers (e.g. UHG, Legacy Studios, Custom Sec Providers)
  • Requires re-creating reports, connectors, etc.
AdditionalNotes:
Modernization drivers of moving to CA for Cloud Pak for Data:

  1. Cost Efficiency (Lifecycle Management)
  2. Agility in data analysis and flexibility (Data Prep, Integration)
  3. SLA/Risk reduction
  4. Planning Analytics Integration/Config & Capacity Management

ModernizationGuidanceNotes:
• >95% functional parity.
  • Modernization paths:
    • Db2 Cartridge on CP4D
    • Db2 standalone containers on OpenShift
    • Db2 on Cloud
  • Weak compelling reason to act.Db2 on Cloud has strong value prop for many clients
AdditionalNotes:
• 3 Options for Db2 Modernization:
    1. Db2 as CP4D cartridge with disruption free backups; also available on ROSA with AWS EBS, EFS support.
    2. Db2 as a Standalone (containerized) on RHOS
    3. Db2 on Cloud (SaaS offering)is available on IBM Cloud, and in AWS and Azure via IBM Satellite. Support PCI compliance (Financial Services Cloud Requirements in Q3 22)
  • Pros: Click-to-Containerize tool, Groud to Cloud Migration tool, Free 1x1 Db2 Modernization workshop with Data Elite team will expedite the migration process for the customer.
  • Cons: SaaS offering is available in certain regions only.
SupportingAssets: • Why Modernize Db2: https://ibm.seismic.com/Link/Content/DC7j3ghDm8FcC82XRGCCCB7hGgWV

ModernizationGuidanceNotes: • Largest inhibitor for most organizations is moving from a centralized ESB team to the concept of Agile Integration
AdditionalNotes:
• Most organizations have concept of a centralized ESB team, responsible for building all integrations using products like IIB, MQ and APIC.
  • This may cause bottlenecks: Centralized team cannot move and change at the speed that cloud native deployments require.
  • Agile Integration attempts to solve this by adopting a container-based, decentralized and microservices-aligned architecture for integration solutions.
SupportingAssets:
• Agile Integration Whitepaper: https://www.ibm.com/downloads/cas/W5GG13RN
  • End to End demo assets for CP4I(maintained by Joel Gomez): https://github.ibm.com/joel-gomez/cp4i-demo

ModernizationGuidanceNotes:
• Most flows running on point product will work on OCP, some changes in configuration might be required to account for OCP specific changes
  • AppConnect Designer missing connectors that product team is addressing
  • If client is migrating from IIB and lacks OCP skills, recommend moving to supported version of ACE (preferably 12.X) as point-product before migrating to CP4I
  • Migration Assistance & Modernization Workshop available
AdditionalNotes:
• Migration Assistance:
    • Transformation Advisor sessions can assess complexity of flows, path to deployment.
    • Integration Modernization workshop recommended to assess and show the value of Modernization. (Client engineering can help)
    • Any migration with a large number of flows should be done with Expert Labs involvement.

ModernizationGuidanceNotes:
• File Transfer Service and Proxy Service is the only capability of Aspera part of CP4I, limited to just 1GBPS
  • Clients needing higher bandwidth will require the Aspera Enterprise version or the CP4I add-on, entailing higher license costs
  • Other Limitations:
    • Limited compatibility with Cloud Object Storage(Currently compatible with IBM Cloud and Amazon S3)
    • No sync functionality
    • Limited compatibility with Console

ModernizationGuidanceNotes:
• Some on-prem features were deprecated and not supported on containers
  • See supporting details for checklist to determine whether containerized or on-prem deployment is most appropriate
AdditionalNotes:
• Container deployment recommended if:
    • Dynamic scalability to adjust to workload
    • Zero downtime support for patching
    • Ability to not only quickly patch or upgrade but quickly rollback to previous versions
    • Better resource usage and management
    • Better resiliency for your applications
    • Lower cost for application isolation
  • On-Prem deployment recommended if:
    • You use deprecated capabilities or artifacts.
    • Your applications contain advanced content that is developed in IBM Integration Designer.
    • You use IBM Business Monitor.
    • You use custom applications that use EJBs.
SupportingAssets:
• Modernization Workshop: https://w3.ibm.com/w3publisher/csm-automation-practice/modernization-workshops
  • Knowledge Center: https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/cloud-paks/cp-biz-automation/22.0.2?topic=automation-business-workflow
  • Migration Enablement: https://ibm.seismic.com/Link/Content/DCbXbWhjd3CPRG9GQHMQJc8DTXXG
  • High Availability & Disaster Recovery for CP4BA FAQ: https://www.ibm.com/support/pages/node/6554434

ModernizationGuidanceNotes:
• The following Operational Decision Manager features are NOT supported in a containerized environment:
    • Repackaging Decision Center and Decision Server customized WAR files
    • Classic rule projects, Decision Validation Services, EJB rule sessions
    • Classic rule engine
    • Invocation through Java APIs and generation of Java client projects that use the Java API
    • Samples console
    • Setting the location of the Decision Center Solr cache and ruleset cache

ModernizationGuidanceNotes:
• Clients should maintain a standard traditional WebSphere Application Server installation if:
    • Platform and software choices are currently not supported by the container platform
    • Use of database or LDAP software versions that are not supported by the container platform
    • Use of custom applications that use the Content Platform Engine EJB protocol
    • Use of Content Platform Engine Virtual Member Manager directory configuration. VMM is not supported by WebSphere Liberty

CloudPak: Cloud Pak for Applications / WebSphere Hybrid Edition
ModernizationGuidanceNotes:
• Changing operational practices from a WAS environment to OpenShift is hard and takes significant time. Regression testing of applications is often a manual process and can take weeks or even months per application. Transformation Advisor at best will reduce the modernization effort by 80%. There WILL be manual effort required.
  • Modernization Paths:
    1. Full refactoring of an existing application to a number of micro-services running on the Liberty runtime in Containers
    2. Runtime modernization: making the smallest number of changes to an existing monolith to make it run on the Liberty runtime in Containers
    3. Operational modernization: moving from WAS ND to traditional WebSphere base in Containers.
AdditionalNotes:
• Most applications can be modernized to Liberty/Open Liberty, recommend Transformation Advisor to assess the feasibility for each application.
  • For some that use features that aren't available on Liberty, the modernization path is to traditional WebSphere base.
  • Small number of applications use some features that are ONLY available on WAS ND, these must either remain on WAS ND or be rewritten.
  • Microservices applications should driven by business needs. Tools like Mono2Micro are not business driven modernization and have a very limited real uptake from customers.
SupportingAssets:
• Modernization Playbook: https://ibm-cloud-architecture.github.io/modernization-playbook/getting-started
  • Modernization Field Guide: https://www.ibm.com/cloud/garage/content/field-guide/app-modernization-field-guide/
  • Modernization Reference Architecture: https://www.ibm.com/cloud/garage/architectures/application-modernization/
  • Transformation Advisor for CSMs: Presentation (https://ibm.box.com/v/TAforTechSales) and Recording (https://ibm.box.com/v/TAforTechSalesRecording)
  • CSM WAS Modernization Workshop (Workshop to educate clients on process of modernizing WebSphere applications: https://github.ibm.com/garage-tsa/AppMod_WiaB
  • Proof of Technology Workshop (Workshop introduces the modernization tools that are included with Cloud Pak for Applications and WebSphere Hybrid Edition and to work through some lab exercises using pre-defined data): https://dte2.us1a.cirrus.ibm.com/collection/5eefa9d504496b425d4dc873

ModernizationGuidanceNotes:
• Available on OCP, but doesn't scale for large enterprise/service provider customers. Migration from NOI to Cloud Pak contains various functionality gaps and migration challenges.
  • More information on specific functionality gaps & associated roadmaps included in Servicer Provider Use Case Spreadsheet.
  • Customers may choose to leave their existing NetCool environment in place and connect it to a new Cloud Native AI Manager/Event Manager environment to take advantage of the new features (however, this adds complexity by having to manage multiple environments).
  • Many big customers have significant investment in their existing NetCool footprint and the migration effort is high for a small return.
AdditionalNotes:
Functionality Gaps (See Service Provider Use Cases)

  • Scaling issues (600 EPS Flow) but a work around exists (see attached diagram) that's currently unviable on OCP product versions.
  • Geo Features unavailable on Cloud Paks
  • UI is limited to 2 personas: DevOps, SRE
  • Can't migrate dashboards to AIOps
  • Can only deploy 1 object and 1 impact server
  • Lack of self-monitoring built into Cloud Pak product
  • IPv6 limitations.
  • Lack of documentation.
SupportingAssets:
• Modernization Guide: https://ibm.ent.box.com/s/91mqm181386qtc1m5beflomknh6tlly6
  • WAIOps Cookbook: https://pages.github.ibm.com/up-and-running/watson-aiops

ModernizationGuidanceNotes: • CAM is part of AIOPS Infrastructure Management now

  • WAIOps Cookbook: https://pages.github.ibm.com/up-and-running/watson-aiops
  • CP4MCM Customer Forward Path Deck: ppt

ModernizationGuidanceNotes: • CloudForms is part of AIOPS Infrastructure Management now

  • WAIOps Cookbook: https://pages.github.ibm.com/up-and-running/watson-aiops

ModernizationGuidanceNotes: • No modernization path on Watson AIOPS. Clients can install a historical reporting DB to capture events/data but cannot run reports on them.
SupportingAssets:
• Modernization Guide: https://ibm.ent.box.com/s/91mqm181386qtc1m5beflomknh6tlly6
  • WAIOps Cookbook: https://pages.github.ibm.com/up-and-running/watson-aiops

ModernizationGuidanceNotes: • Used as a network monitoring tool for additional SMNP based discovery of devices. From here, topology view is built.
SupportingAssets:
• Modernization Guide: https://ibm.ent.box.com/s/91mqm181386qtc1m5beflomknh6tlly6
  • WAIOps Cookbook: https://pages.github.ibm.com/up-and-running/watson-aiops

ModernizationGuidanceNotes: • Instana is not a feature for feature replacement. It may make sense to run Instana alongside the existing Monitoring tool and connect the two together.

CloudPak: Qradar XDR/Guardium/Verify Bundles (Cloud Pak for Security)
ModernizationGuidanceNotes:
• Requires re-building playbooks/integrations; IBM Expert Labs can complete in <40hrs on average via a services engagement.
  • Additional capabilities (Insights, Federated Search) available on CP4S.
AdditionalNotes:
• XDR: Extended Detection & Response
  • New Bundle Capabilities:
    1. XDR: XDR Connect, QRadar SIEM, QRadar SOAR, NDR, SOAR Breach Response, Security Risk Manager (Add-on: ReaQta)
    2. Guardium: Guardium Data Protection, Guardium Insights, Guardium Vulnerability Assessment, QRadar SOAR, SOAR Breach Response, Security Risk Manager
    3. Verify: Verify SaaS, Trusteer Pinpoint Detect, Trusteer Pinpoint Assure, MaaS 360, QRadar SOAR, Security Risk Manager (Add-on: Verify Privilege Vault, Verify Privilege Manager)
  • Containerized Augmentational Products:
    • Universal Data Insights: Federated Search functionality augmenting the scope of alerting sources ingested by the SIEM
  • Insights is native OCP:
    • Guardium Insights: Augments Data Security operations by providing information from data source scans detailing data sources/users at risk, anomalies, reports & any activity that was undertaken as a result of the analysis.
SupportingAssets:
• IBM Cloud Pak for Security - Domain Solutions Pricing and Licensing FAQ: https://ibm.seismic.com/Link/Content/DC3TWpGJVHcMD82WmJbC2VMMjCg8
  • Universal Data Insights Information (Federated Search Functionality): https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/cloud-paks/cp-security/1.10?topic=configuring-connections
  • Guardium Insights Documentation: https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/guardium-insights/3.0.x?topic=overview

CloudPak: Qradar XDR/Guardium/Verify Bundles (Cloud Pak for Security)
ProductReadinessOnOCP: Not Available on OCP ETA: Late 2023
ModernizationGuidanceNotes:
• Starting 7/1/22: We no longer offer CP4S as a stand alone product but iinstead as a set of capabilities contained within the Bundled offerings. Licenses for bundles can be used for point products or components of the previously named CP4S.
  • New parts are listed as QRadar XDR, Guardium & Verify bundles.
  • Active development to containerize products; expected by end of 2023.
  • Current value prop is typically financial, for existing clients to augment use of Qradar SIEM (Increased EPS Flows), SOAR (Unlimited Licenses), recommendation is all Gen 1 & 2 CP4S clients trade up to appropriate bundle.
  • Additional functionality is currently available through 2 containerized products (Guardium Insights, Universal Data Insights).
AdditionalNotes:
• XDR: Extended Detection & Response
  • New Bundle Capabilities:
    1. XDR: XDR Connect, QRadar SIEM, QRadar SOAR, NDR, SOAR Breach Response, Security Risk Manager (Add-on: ReaQta)
    2. Guardium: Guardium Data Protection, Guardium Insights, Guardium Vulnerability Assessment, QRadar SOAR, SOAR Breach Response, Security Risk Manager
    3. Verify: Verify SaaS, Trusteer Pinpoint Detect, Trusteer Pinpoint Assure, MaaS 360, QRadar SOAR, Security Risk Manager (Add-on: Verify Privilege Vault, Verify Privilege Manager)
  • Containerized Augmentational Products:
    • Universal Data Insights: Federated Search functionality augmenting the scope of alerting sources ingested by the SIEM
  • Insights is native OCP:
    • Guardium Insights: Augments Data Security operations by providing information from data source scans detailing data sources/users at risk, anomalies, reports & any activity that was undertaken as a result of the analysis.
SupportingAssets:
• IBM Cloud Pak for Security - Domain Solutions Pricing and Licensing FAQ: https://ibm.seismic.com/Link/Content/DC3TWpGJVHcMD82WmJbC2VMMjCg8
  • Universal Data Insights Information (Federated Search Functionality): https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/cloud-paks/cp-security/1.10?topic=configuring-connections
  • Guardium Insights Documentation: https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/guardium-insights/3.0.x?topic=overview
